meanings.sent1: In the past, people would trade a ducat for goods.
meanings.sent2: The ducat was a currency used long ago in Europe.
meanings.sent3: The pirate found a ducat buried in the sand, thinking it was treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as precious as a ducat, shining brightly in the room.
meanings.sent5: The ducat gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of wealth and history.

meanings.definition: A ticket or token used as a gambling chip
meanings.sent1: At the casino, players exchanged money for ducats to play.
meanings.sent2: The ducat on the table represented the player's bet.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a ducat out of his hat, using it as a magic token.
meanings.sent4: The ducat rolled across the table, a risky gamble in the game.
meanings.sent5: The ducat clinked against the others, adding to the excitement of the game.

meanings.sent1: To her, time spent with family was worth more than any ducat.
meanings.sent2: The painting was a ducat she treasured above all else.
meanings.sent3: He considered his lucky pen a ducat, bringing him success in exams.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a ducat in the room, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The old book was a ducat in the library, holding secrets of the past.
